name: SearchDocuments
documentation:
Request used to perform a search over documents indexed in the Fluxzero search store.

This class is sent to the Fluxzero Runtime and supports a rich query mechanism, pagination, sorting, and selective field filtering.

Query: The {@link #query} field specifies the main search criteria (document type, text query, constraints, etc.).

Sorting: Use {@link #sorting} to specify the fields used for ordering results. Each entry should refer to a field name, optionally prefixed with {@code -} to indicate descending order (e.g., {@code -timestamp}).

Pagination: Use {@link #skip} to offset the result window. The {@link #maxSize} limits the number of results returned. If {@link #lastHit} is provided, the search will continue from the given last result (useful for deep pagination).

Path filtering: The {@link #pathFilters} field lets you restrict which fields are included in each search hit, using glob-like syntax (e.g., {@code details/name}, {@code -private/**} to exclude sensitive paths). Filtering is applied using {@link #computePathFilter()}.

methods.name: computePathFilter
methods.documentation:
Computes a path-level filter based on the {@link #pathFilters} list.

Each entry in the list can be a glob pattern for inclusion (e.g., {@code details/name}) or exclusion (e.g., {@code -details/private/**}).

Patterns are matched against both the short and long form of a {@link Path}, depending on the structure of the pattern. @return a {@link Predicate} that returns {@code true} for paths that should be included in search hits.
